content.content: Just as the title says, BlackRock will offer through Coinbase Prime to exchange cryptocurrencies.    coindesk.com – 4 Aug 22    BlackRock to Offer Crypto for Institutional Investors Through Coinbase Prime The asset management giant and the crypto exchange have partnered to broaden access to crypto among institutional investors.      Several of us already know BlackRock but for people who are still unaware of the power that this investment house has, they could practically call themselves the masters of the world, obtaining the majority of shares in different financial media. Everything BlackRock touches pretty much turns to gold, but I want to be a bit skeptical of this partnership as Coinbase = Circle = USDC = DAI, BlackRock even went so far as to speculate that he was behind the unpeg of USD=UST (which I personally appreciate since we must clean up the crypto industry) now, if this association were to materialize 100%, what possibilities would there be for USDC to have even greater exposure than USDT in the market, a much more adequate support with government entities and conventional companies, that would put DAI in a better place. I have always been in favor of lowering USDC exposure with DAI but I want to take this news with a grain of salt. I wanted to know what the community thinks about what just happened. My conclusion remains the same regarding the future, the massive exposure of crypto is imminent and there is no stopping it, we see enough positive news already, but I am a little scared to know if extreme regulations can harm us.
I was just talking to some colleagues about this. Coinbase just keeps on going, nothing is slowing them down it seems.

I wonder what geography Blackrock is focused on with this partnership. Instutional Investors in the US are already able to invest in cryptos through major players like Fidelity. I am thinking this is an emerging markets play…
Not a novel thought but Coinbase seems like an awfully good buy.

this is interesting news - thanks for posting it. Blackrock clearly sees a business opportunity.  In the short run this is good for Coinbase, but in the longer run BR can learn the digital business and then create their own digital front end, if they see enough value.  That is usually the risk with these strategic partnerships with big established players.
This is amazing! Partnerships like this needed to lift crypto up to the next level! Thanks for sharing @Moi
I wonder if Maker can find a good way to work with Blackrock?
Even while Coinbase is facing ever-growing scrutiny by the SEC they keep building. They have strong momentum right now.
Exactly. It seems like they are soaked with bearishness and now it’ll take only the sun to dry them out.
See this ? Every U.S. Crypto Exchange (And Binance) Is Being Investigated By The SEC, Says Senator Lummis Staffer

The connection is already there, indirectly but it is, Coinbase and Circle are part of us, success is made of connections, what I would like to know is if it could give us benefits it would be great, but as always the spectator of decentralization would not agree so much

Coinbase is looking more and more like TradFi and now that they are public they will have to obey US regulators which will probably end up turning them into an actual TradFi. They are still a good entry to crypto and centralized exchange but if another innovative exchange enters the market they are doomed, globally binance already dominates them 10 to 1.

We know that in difficult times these types of partnerships are very necessary to keep up the pace, this could be a means or excuse that BlackRock is using to broaden and deepen their understanding of the technical workings of Coinbase, and then perhaps replicate it in the future as they have all the resources to do so and better.

IMO, the most interesting angle here is how Maker is onboarding t-bills on-chain. Similarly, Circle is in talks to set up a money market fund with Blackrock. DeFi and TradFi might converge after all. Really excited to see how it plays out!
These actions are necessary, the stronger and better connected always prevail. Not much will change with USDC or others, there will always be uncertainty about their next expansion steps.

Very exciting news! Blackrock has nearly $10T AUM and relationships with every institutional asset manager in traditional finance. This could be a game changer for the space - a bit surprised that Coinbase stock ripped so hard and the overall crypto market was really didn’t move at all.
So who does BR call if they want to do business with MKR?
Great news for the industry! Blackrock is well established and connected. We need more positive news
